results.name: Compound filter (prime signature & sum of the divisors): a(n) = P(A046523(n), A000203(n)), where P(n,k) is sequence A000027 used as a pairing function.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Pairing Function
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
program: A046523(n) = { my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]); };  \\ This function from _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 17 2011
from sympy import factorint, divisor_sigma as D
def T(n, m): return ((n + m)**2 - n - 3*m + 2)/2
return sorted([f[i] for i in f])
def a(n): return T(a046523(n), D(n)) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 12 2017
xref: Cf. A007503, A065608 (sequences matching to this filter), also A000203, A046523, A161942, A286034, A286357.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 10 2017
